channel.title: Will SOMEONE Please help Making a command write a file [PI]
channel.description: Hello, I have tried multiple times and googled and searched here for tuts on how to do this. but how can i make a command (example): ::report (playername) [for] (What they did here) and make what they input into the command go into a file saved server sided.. any ideas: _________ Better example: ::report fallen [then it says "for" No matter what in the text file it makes] (what they did.) _________ Thank you! Help apreciated!!

item.title: Will SOMEONE Please help Making a command write a file [PI]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“xXxSkillerxXx, post:1, topic:426562”]Hello, I have tried multiple times and googled and searched here for tuts on how to do this.
but how can i make a command (example): ::report (playername) [for] (What they did here) and make what they input into the command go into
a file saved server sided… any ideas:

Better example:
::report fallen [then it says “for” No matter what in the text file it makes] (what they did.)

Thank you! Help apreciated!![/quote]

take a look to outputs to txt files from other things like bans or whatever is in your source

@xXxSkillerxXx wrote:

Hello, I have tried multiple times and googled and searched here for tuts on how to do this.
but how can i make a command (example): ::report (playername) [for] (What they did here) and make what they input into the command go into
a file saved server sided… any ideas:

Better example:
::report fallen [then it says “for” No matter what in the text file it makes] (what they did.)

Thank you! Help apreciated!!
